title: With this new set of Malzahar nerfs...
body: Can we just agree his rework was a failure and **revert** him already?!

replies.body: He's getting the Azir/Kalista treatment of old — nerfed into the grave until they can fix how horribly they mangled him. He wasn't even particularly well-designed before the update, but now… Christ. It's depressing.

> I find this treatment extremely unprofessional and that it encourages mediocrity at Riot.

I find it's easy to trashtalk companies when players often don't run a company nor have experience in game design- and even the ones who do have either of those qualities don't have them anywhere near the level Riot does.


> If something is messed up this horribly, you spend time to fix it first.

Not at the cost of pushing back prior projects, no. That is essentially tossing aside money, effort, and the set timetable- the epitome of unprofessional practices.

Urgot's rework has been planned for a long time now. It's his turn on the schedule and they've divided up time, resources, and all manner of things to accommodate this schedule. Changing it up on a metaphorical dime is only going to lead to rushed solutions that bring you right back to the problem board again.


> They'll just push them away until they get a 'rework' when they have only been out for a year (Vel'Koz for example)

I imagine you're talking about the Mage Rework because otherwise Vel'Koz was virtually never touched. And he was updated to give him more options and an actual reason to be picked beyond damage- which he didn't have before. Now he has to choose between maxing Q and W. Now he has to land several skills to get the full potential out of his ultimate. Now he's got a proper niche as the tank-buster since he can ignore resistances.
He also was fairly easy to update, Urgot required a full-scale overhaul, another reason the schedule is so important and shouldn't be changed on a whim.

Malz is likely on the schedule, but the changes they need for him will likely wait until a suitable opportunity.

What? 

No.

Those champs are just added to the rework list, but at the bottom, in terms of priority?

Why? Because of the reasons you mentioned; some champs need it more. Champs like old poppy, yorick and urgot needed updates more than the new champs, which have updated designs and abilities, but aren't healthy for the game.

They devote their times into updating those champs, while temporarily nerfing the new problematic champs, because they simply don't have the workforce for it.

I believe they have two rework teams? The one that did Yorick went to do Urgot while the other finished up WW. Now, as the Urgot is being finished, the WW team moved on to Eve. Why not Azir, Kalista, or Malz? Because they need the updates less than Urgot and Eve. But, if left in their current states, they'd cause problems to the game. So, the only way they can fix it is by nerfs. If nerfs/buffs don't produce satisfactory results, the champ needs to be gutted. 

The third "update team" is the class update team, which I believe is working on divers. When those guys get the chance, they'll pick up some outdated champs and give them some tuning in the corresponding class update, often making them a "small rework." Those occur alongside other problematic class champs that needed  more changes.

Thus, you get champs like Velkoz, Malz, Annie, and Fid as small updates in the MYMU.

It's not mediocre, sloppy, or unprofessional.

>  If something is messed up this horribly, you spend time to fix it first. I get that they want to push things forward, but when you pile crap on top of crap it adds up and people leave due to the stench

And what's causing a bigger stench right now? Urgot literally being shit-tier, or Malz?
At least Azir and Kalista didn't get kicked out of jungle

he was well-designed before update. He had good points and bad points. Talking only about the AP mid malza (got no experience with jungle ad one)
Good points: anti assassin, does damage with his spells, good mid to late game scaling, good peal for his adc, very good zone control
Bad points: can only peal one target off his adc (weak to multiple divers), weak to poke, no escapes, almost always pushes lane (which is bad because no escape)

The rework initially had his power "evenly" distributed around his kit. And he was very broken back then.
Then his ult got gutted to the point its just a suppress and nothing else.
His Q is a silence with mediocre (low) damage. And bad scaling.
His E got nerfed and now does even less damage, because now you need to hit the E target with your Q close to the end of the E duration to refresh the E on the enemy to do a bit slightly more damage than before. And this is bad because his E bounces, it was great for faming minions. But if you now need EQ to kill one minion, the E bounce won't kill the other = failure

So, where did all of Malzahar's power went: to his W and passive.

 Now you have to W then E then hope W is off cool down. Then ult. The delay on his W just makes him feel bad against assassins in Midlane while making him overbearing against immobile opponents, especially when Malz gets Rylais.

He was an **immobile** mage that **pushed** a lane. This is apparently a team game, so put 2 and 2 together.

You misunderstand. Malz didn't push the lane. That minion he got, you know, for playing the game, it pushed the lane. Malz could just hang back. Plus, odds are you would have picked up a Rylias, which mean your AOE pool woould slow, which you could then refresh with a nice 3s Silence.

???

---

> Malz didn't push the lane. That minion he got, you know, for playing the game, it pushed the lane.

Requires 4 spells, Malzahar was a mana hungry mofo early game. Not to mention Voidlings don't get tanky till 7 seconds after being spawned. They can't solo minion waves early game.

> Malz could just hang back.

Also the Voidlings didn't have any sort of minion execute or bonus damage against minions. You still had to go and last hit during the laning phase.

> Plus, odds are you would have picked up a Rylias, which mean your AOE pool woould slow, which you could then refresh with a nice 3s Silence.

Once again... MANA HUNGRY until around level 5-7ish when E had more ranks on it.

The silence on Q wouldn't be 3s until level 13 assuming you put at least 1 point in Null Zone. The laning phase would be long over.

---

Just FYI for the old spells:

Q -> 80 Mana Rank 1
W -> 90 Mana Rank 1
E -> 60 Mana Rank 1 to 120 Mana Rank 5

He starts with 326 mana and only gets 10 mana (14 with Doran's Ring) back per minion kill at the start of the laning phase.

You didn't just spam shit hoping it works early game. You had to plan out how to effectively use the least amount of mana.

---

If you can't figure out an obvious counter to a champion who's ult only worked on one person in a **team game**... I can't help yah buddy.

You never actually played as Malzahar, did you?

Malzahar's voidlings had a tight agro range, which forced Malzahar to keep up with the minion wave, or at the very lest be in Visions range to keep them up with the push.

Also, that minion you got "for playing the game" was also the best designed non-ultimate minion ability in the game as it forced Malzahar to manage his spells and mana to get his Voidlings and stay within range of his target as they were very expensive to simply waste. Even with mana recovery which was to help with spawning more Voidlings, you had to stay within medium to close range to keep it going, preventing stand off plays like classic Yorick and current Malzahar.

Not to mention long ass CDs. Afraid of his R? Wait for E to pop on wave, bait out Q, gasp, suddenly % W and Nethergrasp is the only thing left for 50 years. That generally meant flashing or dying. But noooo, wait around until the wave is gone for some reason and all CDs are back up and THEN try to dive Malz. Yeah, that'll work great. 

A full rotation combo required not pushing, not doing anything for 10+ seconds. R/W by themselves would not kill an assassin at full hp. Ever.

The reason people took him support in the first place is because Riot decided that a fast wave pusher shouldn't be able to push waves anymore. The rework on his minions is what caused him to be played support in the first place. If a pusher can't push, what is he supposed to do? Being played support got rid of these weaknesses because he no longer had to push, and considering he was already an immobile mage vulnerable to ganks, that got rid of his other glaring weaknesses. Riot made him be played support, and then nerfed his solo lane even more making him stay in the support role.

Malzahar is a pale shadow of the well designed champion he was before. His gameplay no longer fits his theme or lore. Giving him the ability to summon on an ability at will just turned him into Yorick 1.5.

Just revert him already!

What I don't get is:   What was wrong with Malz the way he was prior to the MYMU (6.9)?  He was strong but certainly not "broken".  When I refer to "broken" I mean he is now either completely overpowered (like he was right after the MYMU) or practically a troll pick because he's so meager (which is what he is now).  He's not even a top notch support but certainly a better support than mid laner at this point.

Azir - on release he was buggy, overpowered and absolutely not fun to play against.  

Aurellion Sol - Very linear playstyle, boring, had a sickeningly low win rate until fairly recently.  His design is hard to balance in the first place so he is always in a tough spot. 

Taliyah - On the scrap heap.  Nerfed to the ground and not really viable now especially after changing her original W.  

Ivern - Garbage initially, then buffed continuously and is now top 10 win rate champion.  

Camile - So strong on release that she had to be hot fixed and has since been nerfed to death... I never see her anymore.  

Ryze - That speaks for itself.  


None of this bodes well for the new champions they are releasing, does it?
